summary: It’s totally in character for Arya not to want to be the “Lady” of Storms End. Given her knowledge of history she would probably...
body: It’s totally in character for Arya not to want to be the “Lady” of Storms End. Given her knowledge of history she would probably much rather be called the “Stark of Storms End”.

body:
Happy?

Don’t get me wrong… I’m loveing the amount of gendrya fanfiction I’m getting! But it’s makeing me miss those about their time together before the split…. Anybody know any good ones I might have missed?

summary:
What Was Promised (gendrya) | 3/?
        Archive of Our Own
title:
What Was Promised (gendrya) | 3/?
        Archive of Our Own
excerpt: An Archive of Our Own, a project of the Organization for Transformative Works
description:
Summary:

Arya and Gendry have made their peace with the past, but the past hasn’t made its peace with them, and one stormy night it comes to collect its due.

 Married Gendrya. Future fic. AU. 

Ch. 3: Valar Dohaeris

When Arya next woke the storm had finally moved on. The sky beyond the windows was soft and grey, the sea below like ruffled silk. Weak light fell through the glass onto the floor where Gendry sat with Nym, the two of them surrounded by a ring of small wooden animals.

title: fic: “only with careful hands”
body:
read on AO3

~1k, Gendrya, E-rating, Season 8 Canon AU

Summary: Gendry dabs a rag over Arya’s bleeding cut. Most of the boiling wine has been poured onto Gendry’s leg-wound. They survived The Long Night, but he wants to know how Arya truly feels.

summary: Honestly that whAtS weSt oF WeSterOs scene makes me cringe so hard because you can just feel how forced all of this is. How...
body: Honestly that whAtS weSt oF WeSterOs scene makes me cringe so hard because you can just feel how forced all of this is. How random. It‘s not the natural progress of things. It doesn’t flow with the rest of her arc. She’s crying but still somehow determined to leave? She even seems certain that she won‘t come back? Why? It feels like they cut her season 8 arc in two. Her general plotline (reunion, romance, revenge, nk) and her endgame. But it‘s like two pieces of a puzzle that don‘t fit together. None of what she did in season 8 led to that ending that she got. Literally nothing. It‘s bad. Really bad (to quote Gendry here because he‘s fucking right lol).

Literally nothing. It‘s bad. Really bad (to quote Gendry here because he‘s fucking right lol).

Her general plotline (reunion, romance, revenge, nk) and her endgame. But it‘s like two pieces of a puzzle that don‘t fit together. None of what she did in season 8 led to that ending that she got. Literally nothing. It‘s bad. Really bad (to quote Gendry here because he‘s fucking right lol).

blog.name: exiitium
blog.title: they have made worms' meat of me

summary: Upon her arrival at Shipbreaker Bay, Arya felt her insides flip with a mixture of emotions she hadn’t experienced in years. She...
body:
Upon her arrival at Shipbreaker Bay, Arya felt her insides flip with a mixture of emotions she hadn’t experienced in years. She dives off the edge of her ship to keep her wits about her and swims to the coast just as the morning sun begins to break through the heavy clouds.

She treads through the land slowly, taking in the air in her lungs and against her face until she catches sight of a man who is unmistakably Lord Gendry, riding through the morning mist. Waves of doubt wash over her. Will he want to see me? Has he missed and longed for me as much as I have yearned for him? She never stopped loving him, but had he stopped loving her?

She steps out from behind a tree, startling both horse and rider. She takes notice of the immediate and unmaskable mixture of shock and fury that play out on his face as he recognizes hers.

“Arya,”

She swallows hard.

“My lord,”

He scoffs dryly, turning his face away from her.

“I see you still enjoy sneaking up on people,” his tone is curt and acerbic and when he gazes back at her, his stormy, blue eyes are empty of any emotion. “How long have you been here?”

“Just arrived,”

“You’re wet.”

“I swam here,”

He stares at her, hard. She can see he’s thinking up a storm inside of him and she, in turn, feels her heart beating in an unyielding speed inside her chest.

“Well,” he finally says as he turns on his horse, “you must be tired. I’ll arrange to have a room set up for you in the castle. Your crew is welcome to disembark and come ashore. Help yourself to whatever you may need from our supplies at harbor.”

He doesn’t sound welcoming. His remarks lack all the courtesies of a lord yet posses the tone of duty. He is behaving as he’s expected to as Lord of Storm’s End, no more. She is tempted to return to her ship and sail away. She feels foolish and angry and stupid. Bewilderment and shame crush down on her as her eyes burn with tears. She spins on her toes, starting back the way she came when his voice draws her to a halt.

“Arya, get on the horse!” he is angry.

Her chest swells and the tears wash out of her. Silence follows.

Time stops and she stands there, her back to him, as the tears on her cheeks cool her warm face where the salty breeze hits. The horse whinnies and she hears it’s feet stir on the ground.

“Arya,” his tone isn’t soft, “Leave the bullheadedness to me. Get on the damn horse. I don’t intend to make you walk to Storm’s End.”

Her brows furrow as she bites down her lip and rushes to the horse, taking his gloved hand to pull herself up. He reaches behind him and takes her hands, planting them on his sides. His roughness sends electricity through her and she clenches her jaw and grabs him firmly, pulling herself closer. Her pelvis slams against his ass and her chest against his back. She hears his sharp exhale and the grumble of a grunt in his back as he reins the horse. Arya squeezes the beast below her with her thighs as it bolts forward.

That night, after both their tempers have spiraled down into a melancholic, pensive mood and they’ve both sat in the quiet hall saying nothing to one another with only the awkward sound of spoons scrapping up food to fill the space, Gendry finally breaks the silence.

“Arya,” his voice is soft but his eyes are still wary. “You are still my friend. My dearest and closest friend. Years apart haven’t stopped it from being true before.” He grabs his cup and downs the ale then begins to pour more. “It will be an honor to have you as a guest here for as long as you wish to stay. On your terms.”

Their eyes are on each other.

Arya smiles softly and simply nods.

“Thank you, my Lord,”

His nostrils flare a bit at that, which cause her smile to deepen into a toothy grin. Gendry shakes his head and resumes his meal.

That night, after sealing the scrolls she would send out to Winterfell, King’s Landing and the Wall in the morning, Arya blows out the candle. The room fills with darkness before the moonlight settles in. Arya crawls into her bed and lets relief, thrill and nervousness for what was to come, lull her into sleep.

INSPIRATION:

https://optimus-pam.tumblr.com/post/185183486965/arya-stark-rachael-weisz-sails-the-seas-for

summary: Arya: I’m going out tonight ! Jon: Um... alright. Who will you bring along ?  Arya: No one. Jaqen, emerging from the shadows:...
body:
Arya: I’m going out tonight !

Jon: Um… alright. Who will you bring along ?

Arya: No one.

Jaqen, emerging from the shadows: We’ll be back for ten p.m.

reblog.comment:
Arya: I’m going out tonight !

Jon: Um… alright. Who will you bring along ?

Arya: No one.

Jaqen, emerging from the shadows: We’ll be back for ten p.m.

trail.content_raw:
Arya: I’m going out tonight !

Jon: Um… alright. Who will you bring along ?

Arya: No one.

Jaqen, emerging from the shadows: We’ll be back for ten p.m.
trail.content:
Arya: I’m going out tonight !

Jon: Um… alright. Who will you bring along ?

Arya: No one.

Jaqen, emerging from the shadows: We’ll be back for ten p.m.

summary: to the Amazing person that wrote Winter Storm
title: to the Amazing person that wrote Winter Storm
body:
So I found an amazing and beautiful fanfic on ao3 that I fell in love with. I don’t know how to thank enough the person that wrote it. I recommend it to all the gendrya shippers. It’s just a beautiful story and I don’t know how to describe all my feelings about it so I let you to judge. 

Here is the link https://archiveofourown.org/works/13664931/chapters/31388280

But you also can find it on fanfiction.net where she put 19 chapters, while on ao3 there are only 16, https://www.fanfiction.net/s/11139862/1/Winter-Storm 

I just want to share with the gendrya family this work of art

summary: Listening to a podcast of book readers that are saying it's OOC for Tywin to talk to his cupbearer, but idk, I feel like that's...
body:
Listening to a podcast of book readers that are saying it’s OOC for Tywin to talk to his cupbearer, but idk, I feel like that’s sort of the point. During his scenes with her I get the sense that Tywin himself doesn’t know what he’s doing. Being kind has always been akin to showing weakness in Lord Tywin’s mind yet he’s kind to Arya. Rather than this seeming like bad writing, to me, I find it fascinating. We’re human, we all need to give love, as much as we need to receive it. Even Tywin Lannister. He’s deemed it safe to be kind to his little cupbearer whose sharpness interests him, and whose fierceness reminds him of his daughter. Only when no one’s looking of course. Can’t have it be said that Lord Tywin talks to help. I always longed for a scene where Tywin finds out Arya was right under his nose and he let her go, I think it would be a great moment of Tywin kicking himself and just thinking “Love weakens you, love weakens you and I must never let my guard down”.

As I said yeah, the circumstances leading up to Arya being Tywin’s cupbearer are not believable, but Tywin showing kindness isn’t ooc, it just adds a layer of complexity onto his character which I for one love

summary: Logically I recognize that Arya becoming Tywin's cupbearer makes no sense, it's not a good plot point, but damn. Charles Dance...
body: Logically I recognize that Arya becoming Tywin’s cupbearer makes no sense, it’s not a good plot point, but damn. Charles Dance and Maisie Williams just knock it out of the park, every moment they’re onscreen together their dynamic rivets me. I know I’m being tricked and that it’s contrived as hell, but I love it. It’s just very rich in character.

reblog.comment: Logically I recognize that Arya becoming Tywin’s cupbearer makes no sense, it’s not a good plot point, but damn. Charles Dance and Maisie Williams just knock it out of the park, every moment they’re onscreen together their dynamic rivets me. I know I’m being tricked and that it’s contrived as hell, but I love it. It’s just very rich in character.

I know I’m being tricked and that it’s contrived as hell, but I love it. It’s just very rich in character.

Charles Dance and Maisie Williams just knock it out of the park, every moment they’re onscreen together their dynamic rivets me. I know I’m being tricked and that it’s contrived as hell, but I love it. It’s just very rich in character.

summary: Arya’s ending in Game of Thrones is like if Odysseus finally got home after 20 years, chased off Penelope’s suitors and had...
body: Arya’s ending in Game of Thrones is like if Odysseus finally got home after 20 years, chased off Penelope’s suitors and had passionate sex with her, gave his son a hug, and then immediately got back on his ship and sailed off again because he Craves That Adventure.
